txt.en:
'The deep-worms have been reproducing at an alarming rate lately. We've finally narrowed down the location where they keep their eggs.

'They are kept at a place we call Tanunshush. Head north-west until you reach The Burning Stair, just before the Water-works. Tanunshush is just north of there.

'Smash several of their eggs so that we can help keep the population of deep-worms down in the Flaming Deeps.'
'I apologize if that was unpleasant, but it truly was for the best.\n\n'That will allow us dwarves to go about our business and not have to deal with so many deep-worms in the Flaming Deeps.'
'It may not be the most noble act, but it is the only way we can keep the population of deep-worms down.'
The deep-worms of the Flaming Deeps have been reproducing at an alarming rate. The population of these creatures needs to be kept in check.
The deep-worms keep their eggs at Tanunshush, north-west of The Cross-roads of Ash, north of The Burning Stair.\n\nThe population of deep-worms needs to be kept in check by destroying their eggs.
Talk to Ölfun at the Cross-roads of Ash

Ölfun is at the Cross-roads of Ash, south-east of Tanunshush.\n\nÖlfun will want to know that you smashed many deep-worm eggs, contributing to lowering the population of deep-worms in the Flaming Deeps.
